useNumericLiterals.description:
Description

DisallowparseInt()andNumber.parseInt()in favor of binary, octal, and hexadecimal literals
JavaScriptprovides literal forms for binary, octal, and hexadecimal numbers.
For example:0b11,0o77, and0xff.
Using the literal forms enable static code analysis and avoid unnecessary computations.
useNumericLiterals.option: This rule has no specific options.
